nevi-me commented on issue #3340: ARROW-3959: [Rust] Add date/time data types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3340#issuecomment-452226570
 
 
   Looks great @andygrove, I have few questions:
   
   The specification allows for time types to contain a timezone, how easy would it be to add this to Rust in future?
   
   With the data types now present, what other work will we need, potentially as separate JIRAs?
   
   I think:
   
   * Creating types ala `impl ArrowNativeType`
   * Various time arrays and their builders
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

   I don't see any mention of timezone in https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/format/Metadata.rst

nevi-me commented on issue #3340: ARROW-3959: [Rust] Add date/time data types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3340#issuecomment-452308664
 
 
   Sorry Andy, it's mentioned in theL
   
   * flatbuffer schema (https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/format/Schema.fbs#L182), 
   * Java API (http://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/types/pojo/ArrowType.Timestamp.html#Timestamp-org.apache.arrow.vector.types.TimeUnit-java.lang.String-), 
   * cpp (http://arrow.apache.org/docs/cpp/classarrow_1_1_timestamp_type.html#ad0be5cd4daf44dbbcecacfcdd6499a76).
   
   Don't know if the omission from the spec is intentional, but I had gone on the memory that a timezone was a thing since wayback when I started following the Arrow project.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nevi-me commented on issue #3340: ARROW-3959: [Rust] Add date/time data types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3340#issuecomment-452320195
 
 
   Do you think it's better to add timezone as part of this PR, or later? Naively, I assume it's `Timestamp(TimestampUnit, String)`, and then getting + setting it in the `from(json)` and `to_json()` methods?
   
   It looks like from the discussions in [[ARROW-637]](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-637), tz is mainly relevant when displaying to users.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

sunchao commented on pull request #3340: ARROW-3959: [Rust] Add date/time data types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3340#discussion_r246268416
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/datatypes.rs
 ##########
 @@ -56,11 +56,44 @@ pub enum DataType {
     Float16,
     Float32,
     Float64,
+    Timestamp(TimestampUnit),
+    Date(DateUnit),
+    Time32(TimeUnit),
+    Time64(TimeUnit),
+    Interval(IntervalUnit),
     Utf8,
     List(Box<DataType>),
     Struct(Vec<Field>),
 }
 
+#[derive(Serialize, Deserialize, Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq)]
+pub enum TimestampUnit {
+    Second,
+    Millisecond,
 
 Review comment:
   Why we need a `TimestampUnit` given we already have `TimeUnit`? they are exactly the same.

agrove-rms commented on issue #3340: ARROW-3959: [Rust] Add date/time data types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3340#issuecomment-452792677
 
 
   Thanks @sunchao and yes, that's correct. This allows a developer to have a dependency on Arrow and define schemas using Arrow types, even though Arrow does not (yet) provide an implementation of these types.

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: I'm currently working on schema inference for the csv reader, but I got stuck while dealing with timestamps. I had a look at the datatypes.rs, and it looks like timestamps aren't supported in Rust.
